- Achieve within the first 90 days post-launch: $250,000 gross merchandise value (GMV), 2.2% sitewide conversion rate, average order value (AOV) of $68, customer acquisition cost (CAC) under $30, and sub-2.5s median page load on mobile.
- Build a scalable foundation: integrate with a 3PL for fulfillment, implement email/SMS lifecycle marketing, and establish analytics for ongoing optimization.

Strategy
- Platform and architecture: Deploy on Shopify Plus with a mobile-first, performance-optimized custom theme. Use Cloudflare CDN, lazy-loading for images, and structured data for SEO.
- Catalog and content: Launch with 250 SKUs across core categories. Produce studio and lifestyle photography (3 images per SKU), detailed size guides, fit notes, and SEO-optimized product copy.
- Integrations:
  - Payments: Shopify Payments, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay.
  - Fulfillment: ShipBob 3PL integration for real-time inventory and rates.
  - Customer experience: Gorgias for support, Loop for returns, Yotpo for reviews, Recharge for subscriptions on replenishable items.
  - Marketing: Klaviyo for email/SMS, Google Tag Manager + GA4 + Meta Pixel + Google Ads conversion tracking.
- Marketing and growth:
  - Pre-launch: Teaser campaign, waitlist, and influencer seeding.
  - Post-launch: Google Shopping/Performance Max, Meta (Facebook/Instagram) prospecting and retargeting, creator partnerships, and always-on email/SMS flows (welcome, browse/product/cart abandonment, post-purchase cross-sell, replenishment).
  - SEO: Technical baseline (sitemaps, schema, crawl health), keyword-targeted collections and blog content plan.
- Operations:
  - Define service levels for shipping and returns, publish clear policy pages.
  - Train support team on workflows, macros, and escalation paths.
  - Establish weekly performance reviews on traffic, conversion, CAC, ROAS, and fulfillment SLAs.

Timeline (with dates)
- 2025-10-01: Project kickoff, roles and RACI confirmed, success metrics locked.
- 2025-10-01 to 2025-10-07: Discovery and requirements finalization (catalog structure, taxonomy, integrations, policies).
- 2025-10-08 to 2025-10-21: UX/UI design sprints (homepage, PLP, PDP, cart/checkout, account, returns portal); interactive prototypes approved on 2025-10-21.
- 2025-10-15 to 2025-11-12: Theme development and performance optimization; weekly demos on 10/22, 10/29, 11/05.
- 2025-10-20 to 2025-11-15: Integrations (payments, ShipBob, Gorgias, Loop, Yotpo, Recharge, GTM/GA4, ad pixels); sandbox testing completed by 2025-11-15.
- 2025-10-05 to 2025-11-10: Content production (photography, copywriting, size guides); final asset delivery by 2025-11-10.
- 2025-11-01 to 2025-11-25: SEO setup and analytics tagging, conversion events validated; crawl and page speed checks completed 2025-11-25.
- 2025-11-16 to 2025-11-25: QA, accessibility and cross-device/browser testing; bug bash on 2025-11-23.
- 2025-11-26 to 2025-11-28: Soft launch (limited traffic + internal), defect triage and fixes.
- 2025-11-01 to 2025-11-30: Marketing preparation (ad account structures, audiences, creatives, influencer contracts); pre-launch teaser ads run 2025-11-20 to 2025-11-30.
- 2025-12-01: Public launch.
- 2025-12-02 to 2025-12-31: Post-launch optimization (A/B tests on PDP and cart, bid/creative tuning, inventory and returns monitoring); weekly check-ins 12/06, 12/13, 12/20, 12/27.
- 2026-01-01 to 2026-01-31: Scale phase (expanded campaigns, new collections), performance review and roadmap planning on 2026-01-31.

Budget (USD)
- Shopify Plus (Oct‚ÄìDec 2025): $6,000
- UX/UI design: $25,000
- Theme development and performance optimization: $45,000
- Apps and integrations setup (Yotpo, Loop, Recharge, Gorgias, ShipBob): $8,000
- App subscriptions (Oct‚ÄìDec 2025): $3,000
- Photography (250 SKUs, studio + lifestyle): $18,000
- Copywriting (product descriptions, policies, size guides): $6,000
- SEO technical setup and on-page baseline: $10,000
- Paid media:
  - Pre-launch (Nov 20‚Äì30): $10,000
  - Month 1 (Dec 2025): $30,000
  - Month 2 (Jan 2026): $30,000
  - Subtotal paid media: $70,000
- Email/SMS:
  - Platform (Nov‚ÄìDec 2025): $3,000
  - Flow and template setup: $5,000
  - Subtotal email/SMS: $8,000
- 3PL integration and onboarding fees: $7,500
- QA and accessibility testing: $5,000
- Customer support tooling (Gorgias setup + 2 months subscription): $2,600
- Analytics and tagging implementation (GA4, GTM, pixels): $4,000
- Legal/compliance (policies, cookies/consent, terms): $3,000
- Contingency (approx. 10%): $22,700
- Total budget: $249,800

Risks and mitigations
- Integration delays with 3PL or apps:
  - Mitigation: Start integrations in parallel by 2025-10-20, use vendor sandboxes, assign a dedicated integration owner, and schedule weekly vendor check-ins. Maintain a fallback manual fulfillment process for first two weeks post-launch if needed.
- Content production bottlenecks:
  - Mitigation: Lock shot list by 2025-10-06, book studio slots early, run parallel copy and photo workflows, and prioritize top 150 SKUs for launch, with the remainder added in a rolling cadence.
- Scope creep and timeline slippage:
  - Mitigation: Freeze scope at 2025-10-07, implement change control with impact assessments, and reserve contingency resources. Use weekly burn-up charts to monitor progress.
- Site performance issues under load:
  - Mitigation: Lighthouse and WebPageTest performance targets, image optimization pipeline, CDN caching rules, and load testing during soft launch. Define rollback plan and monitoring alerts (uptime and error rates).
- Security/compliance gaps (PCI, privacy):
  - Mitigation: Use PCI-compliant gateways, enforce HTTPS and HSTS, implement consent management for cookies, publish privacy/returns/shipping policies, and conduct a security review before launch.
- Marketing underperformance (low ROAS, high CAC):
  - Mitigation: Diversify channels, run creative and audience tests, implement server-side tracking where supported, set daily budget caps, and shift spend toward high-performing ad sets; align with email/SMS to lift blended CAC.
- Inventory mismatches and stockouts:
  - Mitigation: Real-time inventory sync, safety stock levels, reorder points, and website badges for low stock. Enable back-in-stock notifications and clear ETAs.
- Customer support overload post-launch:
  - Mitigation: Staff surge coverage for launch week, pre-built macros for common inquiries, clear self-serve FAQs, and escalation paths. Monitor first response and resolution SLAs daily.
- Budget overrun:
  - Mitigation: Bi-weekly budget tracking, purchase order approvals for non-core expenses, and use contingency only for critical path items. Rebalance paid media spend based on performance.
